list_definition.definition: to make a thorough search of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They scoured the woods for the lost child.

list_ex_of_english: Imports have been encouraged and the world has been scoured for goods.
The wool scouring business is doing much better.
More elbow grease was applied to the scouring of a pot than, probably, to any other household task.
The main substances removed by scouring are small deposits of aluminium compounds and ferrous material formed by oxidation.
I imagine it is those in which soap has to be used in scouring wool yarn.
We are scouring the world for these supplies of timber, and it is not easy; but we shall go on trying.
We have not asked for the whole of the heath to be mechanically scoured.
I am keen to see an increase in the use of the private finance initiative for the scouring of public projects.
